content: For subscription resource, channel.payload is a mandatory field( 1:1) and for non-payload subscriptions, the spec says to keep this field as blank. However this blank field does not make sense for JSON and even the reference implementation removes any such blank fields. So when to try to validate the existence of mandatory fields of a resource, it breaks. Can we have an alternate mechanism to indicate no-payload rather than blank?
that's an oops. Can you make a task to fix that, and I suggest that you use n/a in the meantime
